A **lucern hammer** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a [two-handed](/wiki/Two-handed "Two-handed") [polearm](/wiki/Polearm "Polearm") that is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and appears as a **pronged polearm** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Origin](#Origin)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [5.2 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [5.3 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [5.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

In addition to random generation, general [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and antique weapons outlets can sell lucern hammers.

[Watchmen](/wiki/Watchmen "Watchmen") and [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") may [be generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a lucern hammer.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

A [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong") [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") monster with a weapon attack, the ability to wield weapons and no other ruleset governing its [monster starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") has a chance of generating with a lucern hammer, unless they are being generated on the [Rogue level](/wiki/Rogue_level "Rogue level"): the base odds are 1⁄14 for normal monsters, 1⁄12 for a monster that is a [lord](/wiki/M2_LORD "M2 LORD") or [nasty](/wiki/Nasty "Nasty"), 1⁄10 for a monster that is an [overlord](/wiki/M2_PRINCE "M2 PRINCE") or both a lord and nasty, and 1⁄8 for a monster that is both nasty and an overlord.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Strategy

The lucern hammer is tied for the heaviest polearm with the [halberd](/wiki/Halberd "Halberd") at 150 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum"), and while its average damage against [small](/wiki/Small "Small") monsters is stellar by polearm standards, its average damage against large monsters is the lowest among the weapon type, and several other polearms offer similar or better damage in both respects while weighing far less.

## History

The lucern hammer is introduced with all other polearms in [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), two [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") lucern hammers are introduced, named [Ogresmasher](/wiki/Ogresmasher "Ogresmasher") and [Thunderfist](/wiki/Thunderfist "Thunderfist") - Ogresmasher has its base item changed to a war hammer in [NetHack 3.0.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.3 "NetHack 3.0.3"), while Thunderfist is replaced with [Mjollnir](/wiki/Mjollnir "Mjollnir") in that same version.

## Origin

[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Lucerne hammer](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucerne_hammer "wikipedia:Lucerne hammer")***

[![Lucernhammers.png](/images/a/ad/Lucernhammers.png)](/wiki/File:Lucernhammers.png)



The Lucerne hammer is a type of polearm that was popular in Swiss armies during the 15th to 17th centuries, and was named for the Swiss city where many polearm weapons were discovered and originated from. It consisted of a three-to-four-pronged 'hammerhead' (hence its appearance in *NetHack*) that bears a long spike on its opposite side, and has an even longer spike extending from the top; some are occasionally found to have spikes on the side of the head as well. The hammerhead is mounted atop a 2-meter-long (6.5 foot) polearm shaft, with the forward-pointing spike used for spearing, and the long pole increased the velocity of the head, making the hammer more effective at puncturing or smashing armour as well as dismounting opponents like most (if not all) polearms.

The lucern hammer is sometimes confused for the more "traditional" and blunt [war hammer](/wiki/War_hammer "War hammer"), which among other things may have been responsible for the creation of Thunderfist.

## Variants

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), the lucern hammer has its weight reduced to 85 aum.

[The Hammer of Barquiel](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Hammer_of_Barquiel "DNetHack artifacts") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") large lucern hammer that is lawful, intelligent and made of [silver](/wiki/Silver "Silver"). It grants +1d7 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") and +1d10 damage versus all monsters, and while wielded it grants [automatic searching](/wiki/Automatic_searching "Automatic searching") and [blindness resistance](/wiki/Blindness_resistance "Blindness resistance"), and acts as a [light source](/wiki/Light_source "Light source"); targets that it strikes may be [blinded](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), [gremlins](/wiki/Gremlin "Gremlin") are reduced to dust, and [trolls](/wiki/Troll_\(monster_class\) "Troll (monster class)") are [petrified](/wiki/Petrified "Petrified").

### NetHack Fourk

[NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk") removes the lucern hammer and many other polearms.

### xNetHack

[xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack") removes the lucern hammer and many other polearms, and gives the lucern hammer's damage dice to the [bec de corbin](/wiki/Bec_de_corbin "Bec de corbin").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the lucern hammer is the only polearm that is not off-limits to [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest"), who are forbidden from using any form of piercing or slashing weapon at risk of a major penalty to [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record").

A lucern hammer can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [heavy war hammer](/wiki/Heavy_war_hammer "Heavy war hammer") and a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear").

All of the above information also applies to [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM").

## Encyclopedia entry

- *See the [encyclopedia entry for polearm](/wiki/Polearm#Encyclopedia_entry "Polearm").*
